title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.5 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Output 5 (WASH in emergencies): National and subnational governments and partners have enhanced capacity to develop an adaptive WASH cluster contingency response plan, integrated baseline data, and effectively coordinate inclusive and gender-responsive emergency response., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys and their families, especially the most vulnerable, increasingly use safely managed and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, adopt critical hygiene practices, and live in resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5 (WASH in emergencies): National and subnational governments and partners have enhanced capacity to develop an adaptiveWASH cluster contingency response plan, integrated baseline data, and effectively coordinate inclusive and gender-responsiveemergency response.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Government’s COVID-19 WASH response focusing on reducing current transmission along with building community resilience and long-term sustainability of WASH interventions. With UNICEF’s support, the WASH in Emergency sector’s capacity to better coordinate, prepare and respond to humanitarian situations is strengthened through the development of a comprehensive roadmap and ongoing capacity building programmes. UNICEF’s support has contributed towards reinforcing government systems for monitoring handwashing practices, including use of masks and social distancing, and further bolstered the Public–Private Partnership on Handwashing with Soap (PPP-HWWS) coalition to amplify handwashing promotion and support to the safe reopening of schools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/11/2021

title.narrative: Existence of a functioning cluster coordination mechanism for WASH in humanitarian situations, Text

baseline.value: (WASH cluster coordination is fragmented between several ministries, resulting in unclear leadership)

target.value: 2025:Sector/cluster coordination mechanism operational under Government leadership with clear roles and responsibilities

actual.value: 2021:Roadmap and capacity development plan developed for strengthening the coordination mechanisms
